CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 26, 1946, pg. 3, reads: "They Identified Policemen - Mrs. Bernice Carrington of 2919 Wylie Avenue, who rents a room to Morris Hodge of Brownsville (far left), alleged to have been beaten by two Central Police Station patrolmen Saturday, confers with Hodge and Atty. Paul F. Jones, chairman of the NAACP Legal Redress Committee (center), here Wednesday, during a recess in the Police Trial Board hearing in Superintendent of Police Harvey Scott's office.  Three policemen were suspended and fined for brutality as a result of the hearing. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Bernice Carrington, Paul F. Jones, and Morris Hodge standing outside of office of Superintendent of Police Harvey J. Scott
